intro: Arracacia tolucensis var. multifida, commonly known as the multifid leaf arracacia, is a herbaceous plant native to the humid forests of South America. It is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that are deeply divided into multiple lobes, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typically borne on slender peduncles. Its botanical features make it a notable species within the Apiaceae family, known for its aromatic properties. The plant is often found in shaded, moist environments, contributing to the biodiversity of its native ecosystems.
